item.title: 1st Pop Up Sig
item.dc:creator: @Zigon Zigon
item.description:
@Zigon wrote:

Not bad. I don’t like how the backgrounds’ a little to repetitive with the brushes, I think it’s a little to big and the colors don’t seem to blend together between the guy and the background. Basically what everyone else is pointing out =P.

Read full topic

item.title: 1st Pop Up Sig

item.description:
@Gotta_Catch_Them_All wrote:

I like it, very nice.

Offtopic. On the Vb skin it has a big grey box above the sig and I didn’t understand how it popped up until I put default skin back on lol.

item.title: 1st Pop Up Sig
item.dc:creator: @usernamelol .Fusion
item.description:
@usernamelol wrote:

Make the render blend… not just a plain background.

Read full topic

item.title: 1st Pop Up Sig
item.dc:creator: @alexia alexia
item.description:
@alexia wrote:

Alex Hodgens made the image, if it helps at all. He is quite popular at Runescape Community.

Anyways… now for the rating.

  1. Too large. Anything with over a 460px width makes a crap signature.

  2. Ever heard of transparent? Don’t try to match a background color… just make the top bit transparent and save it as a .gif ( .png works, but only for the people that use FireFox. To reach a broader range of viewers, go with .gif )…

  3. The background is a bit too repeating. Looks like you just used the same brush over and over again.

  4. The text is hard to read. Consider making it white, with a 1-3px black stroke around it. Also, the text in the top-left corner is un-needed. If you truly want to keep it, keep it’s blending mode at normal so that it is readable.

-Alexia

Read full topic

item.title: 1st Pop Up Sig
item.dc:creator: @kaza Kaza
item.description:
@kaza wrote:

hmmmmm, i wouldnt really call this a pop-up…its just a render on a part of a transparent bg, it doesnt blend, but hey, atleast on your first pop-up it had a transparent bg, mine didnt :S i didnt know how lol…

still, only 5/10 max.

Read full topic

item.title: 1st Pop Up Sig
item.dc:creator: @Immortal Immortal
item.description:
@Immortal wrote:

There is hardly any blending, if not any at all, between the render and the background. Colours don’t even match, you should use a gradient map to blend colours better. Lighting and flow is missing and the text is… well it needs some work

Sorry for being harsh, but hey, CC is useful for improving your skill, don’t take it personally

Read full topic

I dont know. Doesnt really matter
